author: alx9r
body:
Steps to reproduce
------------------

```powershell
$numProgressBars = 10

foreach ($i in 1..100)
{
    $id = $i % $numProgressBars
    Write-Progress $id -Id $id -PercentComplete $i
    sleep -Milliseconds 50
}
```

Expected behavior
-----------------

I expected the progress bars to behave nicely like this, except showing 10 activities:

![repro-8-activities](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11237922/44009428-a8fe1424-9e60-11e8-85ca-2d3d2da5e86a.gif)


This is a capture of  `$numProgressBars=8`.

Actual behavior
---------------

Instead, the progress bars seem to jump around like this:

![repro-10-activities](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11237922/44009450-d29a09dc-9e60-11e8-899a-1be30e0e5084.gif)

This is a capture `$numProgressBars=10`

Environment data
----------------

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```powershell
> $PSVersionTable

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.1.0-preview.4
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    6.1.0-preview.4
OS                             Microsoft Windows 6.3.9600 
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0

```

comments.body:
Similiar problem, result are not consistent when on powershell 7 linux (I'm on Debian, using snap) you run next code, playing with $x (see for example when $x is 5, 6 or 7 (each one gives you a different layout):
```
while ($true) { 1..$x |% { write-progress -activity test -percentComplete (get-random -maximum 99) -id $_ }; start-sleep -m 100}
```

For 5 "o" and xx% are mixed
For 6 seems like ok, though a new line I think could be removed
For 7 not consistent result comparing with 6

Thank you!

title: Reporting progress on more than 9 activities results in inscrutable progress bars
